intro: Anisomeris monantha, commonly known as the desert star, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant has a woody base with succulent, fleshy stems and leaves that are typically gray-green in color, adapted to conserve water. Its flowers bloom in the spring and summer, producing yellow to orange petals that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Anisomeris monantha is well-suited to dry climates and is often found in rocky soils and desert scrub habitats.
